snippet: With Spain’s economic crisis forcing feuding couples to stay together, a judge in Seville ordered a divorcing couple to split their apartment into two independent abodes.
abstract: Economic crisis in Spain has had unintentional consequence of forcing warring couples who cannot afford divorces to remain together, and now a judge in Seville is ordering a divorcing couple to split their 2,700-square-foot apartment down the middle into two independent abodes.

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and SILVIA TAULÉS
byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky reported from Paris, and Silvia Taulés from Barcelona, Spain.

lead_paragraph: With Spain’s economic crisis forcing feuding couples to stay together, a judge in Seville ordered a divorcing couple to split their apartment into two independent abodes.

headline.main: Judge in Spain Partitions Home of Feuding Couple
headline.print_headline: Judge in Spain Partitions Home Of Feuding Couple
